column5: The mostly usual cast and crew left the GTA on Friday morning, heading up to Nip for our annual GTG with Bernie at his cottage. With Friday being a non fishing day, we arrived mid afternoon and began the process of planning our attack on Saturday morning, over a few beverages of choice. Generally, we did well over the weekend, with many "cigars" caught over the three days of fishing. An east wind and on and off showers was the ticket from the weather man, but mostly totally manageable. Sunday afternoon/evening was our best day with limits caught by all... and a number of "slot" fish released as well. Seems we left the Skunk in Whitby! LOL The other guys took some pics and I'll let them post them up here when time permits. A special thanks once again to Bernie for the invite. We all really appreciate the opportunity  to share the time and always find a way to laugh the weekend away. Thanks again Bernie and already lookin forward to September! HH
Finally, an easy "limit" to catch. Glad the fish were cooperating. Not much down in the western part of the lake.
Pictures!
Soon Chris.
Yes we need fish porn !!!!
I'll have a couple of pics up this evening.  Thanks for the report Joe!
sounds like a good time

Here are some pics from the weekend. Didn't take too many as it's hard to shoot when you are laughing.  Joe up front jigging away.   Mike with a keeper.   Will and Rueben close by. Will always moves up close when he sees us catching   Joe in action.   Netting another fine one.

Will and Rueben close by. Will always moves up close when he sees us catching   Joe in action.   Netting another fine one.  thanks for having us Bernie! actual conversation from the above pic, from within Will's boat: Will: <quack> Rubin: oooohhh Willlllllll!! you're killing me Willlll!  the two biggest catches of the weekend has to goto Bernie's screen door..

Nice shots Bernie.  Mike....what happens at Bernie's stays at Bernie's....damn screen door.  I didn't take many shots either but here's a few.  Sunset on Friday as we anticipate the opening of the season.    First eye of the season and the release.       Mike with a nice pike that was taken during nap time for some.      My boat in it's happy place.    And the last night sunset shot.    It was a great fish that night with Mike.  Lots of cigars, a couple in the slot and a few keeper sizes.  Good times.  Another great trip in the books and can't wait till the fall.
Sweet, sweet lady nipissing.  Awesome weekend
Always enjoy the weekend at Bernie's posts. You're my kinda guys.
Awesome. That first sunset shot is killer Will!!!
Those sunset pictures are amazing Will!!!  Looks and sounds like a great time!

Another classic Bernie weekend it seems!  Don't worry Joe, I will be gracing your presence for the September trip, so you can just relax in the cottage and not waste your time trying to catch fish  Will, that really is a great sunset picture!!  I may steal it for my wallpaper on my computer!  Glad to hear you guys got into some numbers on this trip...it always is more fun when you catch lots of fish (or at least so I hear!!) LOL.

How could I forget the screen door incident! I must have "swept that memory away"! Cliff, break out the guitar and get ready for the fall trip... apparently the "crowd" wants us to be able to play a song from beginning to end! Great pics guys... thanks for adding them. HH
Another good time had by all, great report. Will that sunset pic of yours is absolutely fantastic!

that door is in a really bad spot, so i can see how these kind of incidents happen...  i'm actually surprised that rubin's tiny calves didnt slip right through the screen.. equally as surprising was that Will's ghost like tan, doesnt possess ghostly abilities needed to pass through objects..

Well done again, Bernie what a fantastic weekend. Always fun to b there, except for the GAS MASTERS, you were just rallying with the crowd. Mike you should open a GAS PLANT, since there is a need !!!!???? Such a weekent is never TOO MUCH FUN.
Good job catching them wallies, guys  x10 on that sunset shot!
